meanings.definition: The condition of a solution that contains more of a dissolved substance than could be dissolved by the solvent under normal circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The supersaturation of sugar in the water made it crystalize quickly.
meanings.sent2: The supersaturation of the salt solution caused salt crystals to form at the bottom.
meanings.sent3: The supersaturation of the lemonade made it so sweet that even ants avoided it.
meanings.sent4: The supersaturation of knowledge in his mind overflowed with new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The supersaturation of colors in the painting created a mesmerizing effect.

meanings.definition: The state of being more than full or completely filled.
meanings.sent1: The supersaturation of the room with guests made it feel crowded.
meanings.sent2: The supersaturation of the jar with marbles made it difficult to close the lid.
meanings.sent3: The supersaturation of the suitcase with clothes made it impossible to zip up.
meanings.sent4: The supersaturation of the market with vendors created a lively atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The supersaturation of the bookshelf with books made it a challenge to find a specific one.
